Compute Log-Likelihoods for All Grid Values of PSD (Poisson)

Source: R/01_likelihood.R
compute_L_poisson_helper_seq.Rd

Computes the log-likelihood for a single dataset across all values of psd_iwp specified in the grid. This function iteratively calls compute_L_poisson_helper for each grid value.

compute_L_poisson_helper_seq(
  data_i,
  grid,
  num_basis = 30,
  betaprec = 1e-06,
  order = 2,
  pred_step = 1
)

Arguments

data_i

A single dataset extracted from the data_list component of fash_set_data. Must be a list containing y, x, and offset.

grid

A numeric vector representing the grid of PSD (Predictive Standard Deviation) values.

num_basis

An integer specifying the number of O-Spline basis functions.

betaprec

A numeric value representing the precision of the fixed effects coefficients (`beta`).

order

An integer specifying the order of the Integrated Wiener Process (IWP) prior.

pred_step

A numeric value specifying the prediction step size.

Value

A numeric vector of log-likelihood values, one for each grid value.

Examples

# Example usage
set.seed(1)
Y <- matrix(rpois(20, lambda = 5), nrow = 4, ncol = 5)
smooth_var <- matrix(runif(20), nrow = 4, ncol = 5)
offset <- 1
fash_data <- fash_set_data(Y, smooth_var, offset)
grid <- seq(0.1, 2, length.out = 10)
likelihoods <- fashr:::compute_L_poisson_helper_seq(
  data_i = fash_data$data_list[[1]], grid = grid
)
